What new features are being added to the Verus Desktop application, and how can the Verus community contribute to the ecosystem?

The Verus Desktop application is being enhanced with several new features. One of the key updates is the revamping of the Multiverse tab, which will provide users with insights into the blockchain economics and make it easier to search for currencies. Another exciting feature is the ability to visualize the network, allowing users to see the connections between all the blockchains, bridges, and currencies.

Additionally, the Verus community is actively contributing to the ecosystem in various ways. For instance, community members are sharing their mining rig setups on the Verus Discord, which can serve as inspiration for others who want to try mobile mining Verus. The community is also actively developing and using tools such as VerusBox and VerusMiner9000 to make mining Verus easier and more accessible.

Overall, the Verus Desktop updates and community contributions are aimed at making the Verus ecosystem more user-friendly, accessible, and decentralized.

New Verus Desktop Features
In the upcoming new Verus Desktop release, the Multiverse-tab has been revamped and you’ll be able to get insights into the blockchain economics and easier ways to search for currencies.
Testnet visualization.
Another added feature is that you can visualize the network to see the connections between all the blockchains, bridges and currencies.
